meanings.sent1: The toy had an ejectable feature that made it easy to launch into the air.
meanings.sent2: The ejectable seatbelt allowed for quick release in case of an emergency.
meanings.sent3: The ejectable button on the remote control made it fun to change channels.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like ejectable rockets, ready to take off at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The ejectable mechanism on the camera ensured fast lens changes.

meanings.definition: Able to be thrown out or removed
meanings.sent1: The old batteries were no longer ejectable from the remote control.
meanings.sent2: The ejectable trash bin made it convenient to dispose of waste.
meanings.sent3: He found the ejectable sticker on his shirt amusing as it kept falling off.
meanings.sent4: The ejectable players from the team were quickly replaced with new talent.
meanings.sent5: The ejectable parts of the puzzle made it easier to assemble.
